activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian V Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety. Comply with Drug Treatment Court. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian V Smith

Pretrial Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian V Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Brian V Smith. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
